thread.title: Indicted Former Senate Leader Skelos Won’t Go Away
thread.title_full: Indicted Former Senate Leader Skelos Won’t Go Away

author: Ryan Haas
title: Indicted Former Senate Leader Skelos Won’t Go Away
text:
Share Photo credit: Reuters | Eduardo Munoz 
Former state Senate Majority Leader Dean Skelos, indicted with his son and facing trial on six corruption counts, is becoming an issue in the heated race for Nassau County District Attorney. 
Acting DA, Democrat Madeline Singas, who took over after her boss Kathleen Rice was elected to Congress, is running a TV ad featuring two photos of her opponent, Hempstead Town Supervisor Kate Murray, with a smiling Skelos. 
Skelos is accused of pressuring a real estate developer and a medical malpractice insurance firm to benefit his son Adam with no-show jobs and business deals. 
The Murray campaign is featuring an ad attacking Singas for not firing a top staffer whose wife claims he is a sexual fetishist and spouse abuser.
